definition: A communicative indicator or linguistic pattern that suggests the presence of fraudulent intent or deceptive storytelling, typically characterized by urgency, emotional manipulation, or inconsistencies that reveal an attempted scam.

positive_examples: Your account has been compromised! Click here immediately to verify.
You've inherited $2.5 million from a distant relative in Nigeria.
This investment guarantees 50% returns with zero risk.
You must act now or lose this once-in-a-lifetime opportunity forever!
We need your social security number to process your prize.
negative_examples: Take your time to verify this through official channels.
Be skeptical of unsolicited offers that seem too good to be true.
Legitimate organizations don't ask for sensitive information this way.
Contact the company directly through their official website.
There's no rush - good opportunities don't require instant decisions.
training_hints.disambiguation: Detects scam narrative patterns versus legitimate communication. Key markers: urgent action required, too-good-to-be-true, pressure, request for sensitive info.
